content.description: Stem, crimp, jam, smear, it's a Storybook Problem.  Uses the right facing corner heavily.
content.location: The obvious corner route.  Part of the CENTER STAND sub-area.

content.description: Sprint for the downward arrowhead shaped pod, on great finger stacks and decent enough feet.  Rest, if you can, then twist your way through the flaring and blocky sections to the anchor.
content.protection: double rack of C4's, from smallest to wide hands
content.location: The obvious crack to the right of Storybook Problem .  Part of the CENTER STAND sub-area.

content.description: Climbs the left side of the face (that forms the dihedral of Storybook Problem).  Starts slightly slabby, then offers plenty of vertical.
content.location: On the left face that forms the dihedral (of Storybook Problem).  Part of the CENTER STAND sub-area.

content.description:
Crimps and slots all the way up the imposingly vertical face.  Keep those edgy toes alive! 

  Does have a great belay spot at its base.  Belay from the base of the climb to the right, on the larger ledge.
content.location: The first route of the CENTER STAND sub-area, as you traverse around the corner (on the hand cable) from STRINGS sub-area.

content.description: Various climbs that begin from an elevated ledge.
